etymology.description: 欺 (to deceive; bully) + 负/負 (to wrong; mistreat; bear guilt) = to bully/oppress.
etymology.interpretation: Conveys picking on someone by deception, intimidation, or unfair treatment, often taking advantage of weakness. Common with objects (欺负小孩) and in passive forms like 被/受欺负.
etymology.simplification: Only 負 was simplified to 负, a standard reduction of the 貝 component; 欺 is unchanged.

parts.english: to deceive; to cheat; to bully; to look down on
to bear; to owe; to be defeated; to wrong

examples.chinese: 他小时候常被同学欺负(他小時候常被同學欺負)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiǎo shíhou cháng bèi tóngxué qīfu.
examples.english: He was often bullied by his classmates when he was young.

examples.chinese: 弱小的人不该被欺负(弱小的人不該被欺負)。
examples.pinyin: Ruòxiǎo de rén bù gāi bèi qīfu.
examples.english: The weak should not be bullied.
